Cherry¶

cherry.initialise¶

Set up a scraping run

cherry.initialise.initialise_run(source_file_name)¶

Set a scraping run by creating settings, files and configuring options

Args:
source_file_name (str):The source urls or dois to scrape with to resolve dois to metadata

Create a Scrapy settings object to be referred to in all scraping Create a directory based on the current date and time to place results in Pickle the settings object so it can be maintained if scraping fails or must pause

cherry.seek¶

Scraping framework for finding and identifying dois on webpages Requires external argument with filename of inputted json file The json file must be a list of json objects with fields ‘url’:url and ‘root’: the domain the scraper is allowed to explore

cherry.seek.perform_scrape(input_list)¶

perform a scrape using seekspider to find webpages containing dois

Args:
input_list (list): list of dicts with keys url and root containing the url to start from and the domain to contstrict scraping to

cherry.collect¶

Module for running PickSpider and ShakeSpider

cherry.collect.get_pick_joblist(file_name)¶

get the list of scraping destinations for PickSpiders to run on from inputted file

Args:
file_name (str): name of json file of list of inputted websites
Returns:

start_urls (list): list of url strings to visit

allowed_domains (list): list of allowed domains to constrain spider to

cherry.collect.get_shake_joblist(file_name)¶

Get dois and list of source urls for a ShakeSpider to run on from inputted file

Args:
file_name (str): name of json file of list of inputted dois to run
Returns:
dois (list): list of inputted dois to scrape on doi_sources (list): list of urls the dois in the list of dois originate from
cherry.collect.perform_scrape(pick_or_shake)¶

Perform a Scraping run for either a PickSpider or Shakespider.

Args:
pick_or_shake (str): string ‘pick’ or ‘shake’ specifiying what spider to run

cherry.consume¶

Run a MunchSpider to resolve more metadata from dois with partially resolved metadata from a Crossref Scrape (from a ShakeSpider or PickSpider)

cherry.consume.get_domains(dbcoll)¶

get allowed web domains to constrain the MunchSpider to

Args:
dbcoll (object): queriable object (MongoDB cursor or FakeMongo object) to get pubisher domains from
Returns:
domains (list): list of web domains to constrain spider to
cherry.consume.get_joblist(file_name)¶

get the urls to visit during scraping from the dois in the inputted json file

Args:
file_name (str): name of json list file to extract dois from, each element must have key ‘doi’. Should be list of json serialised CherryItems.CrossRefItems for correct running of code
Returns:

doi_links (list): urls to visit for resolving dois in file_name

doi_sources (dict): keys are dois, values are all additional metadata for the doi found from crossref

cherry.consume.get_publisher_database(settings, mongo=True)¶

Get a queryable database for the Munchspider to look up publisher xpaths

Args:

settings (Scrapy Settings object): The current Scrapy settings

mongo (bool): True if using mongodb, False if using Fake_Mongo interface

Returns:
publisher_database (object): queriable object (MongoDB cursor or FakeMongo object) for getting publisher Xpaths at runtime or getting publisher domain names
cherry.consume.perform_scrape()¶

Perform a MunchSpider scrape using the current Scrapy Settings

cherry.analyse¶

Module for analysing scraping runs and producing reports

cherry.analyse.perform_analysis()¶

Produce scraping report after scraping run

Loads the current settings and analyses collected data in the error datastore and complete records datastore. Creates a file with name specified in the settings object as ‘REPORT_FILE_NAME’.

cherry.scrapingtools¶

library of useful functions for use in Cherry module scraping

cherry.scrapingtools.clean_doi(d)¶

Clean a doi identified by regex pattern matching by removing html tags, commas etc

Args:
d (str): doi string with html tags attached
Returns:
clean (str): cleaned doi string
cherry.scrapingtools.dump_record(self, record, file_name)¶

json serialise a scraped record and write it to json list file

Args:

record (object or primitive): anything json-serialisable to write to file

file_name (str): name of json file to write serialised record to

cherry.scrapingtools.finalise_file(file_name)¶

Make a json document list built item-by-item legal and final by appending ‘]’

Args:
file_name (str): The name of the file to finalise
cherry.scrapingtools.find_dois(txt)¶

return list of DOIs in free text

uses regex modified from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27910/finding-a-doi-in-a-document-or-page Alix Axel’s regex, with modifications http://stackoverflow.com/users/89771/alix-axel

Args:
txt (str): text corpus to search for dois in
Returns:
dois (list): list of doi strings found in text
cherry.scrapingtools.get_aff(auth)¶

Normalise form of scraped affiliations

Handles various formats of affiliations scraped from crossref, maping them to a list

Args:
auth (dict): author information recieved from crossref api
Returns:
affs (list): list of strings of affiliations for author
cherry.scrapingtools.get_author(auth)¶

Normalise the form of a scraped author name

handles various cases of author names and maps them to format ‘ABC Lastname’

Args:
auth (dict): author information recieved from crossref api
Returns:
clean (str): normalised author name
cherry.scrapingtools.get_crossref_item(mess)¶

create :class:CherryItems.CrossRefItem from message recieved from crossref

Args:
mess (dict): message recieved from Crossref API for particular doi
Returns:
item (CherryItem.CrossRefItem): populated partially complete metadata for article
cherry.scrapingtools.get_date(mess)¶

Get and Normalise the Earliest date of publication from message recieved from crossref

Args:
mess (dict): message recieved from crossref API for particular doi
Returns:
pub_date (Datetime): the earliest date in the record, wrapped in datetime object
cherry.scrapingtools.get_journal(journal_list)¶

Helper function for :func:get_crossref_item

Args:
journal_list (list): list of journals an article was published in (usually length is 0 or 1)
Returns:
journal (str): first journal in journal_list or None if length is zero
cherry.scrapingtools.get_settings()¶

load Scrapy settings from pickled state in ‘settings.txt’

Returns:
settings (Scrapy.Settings): A scrapy settings object picked to a text file
cherry.scrapingtools.initialise_file(file_name)¶

Create a json list file ready to be streamed json objects.

Creates file and writes ‘[‘ ready for first json serialised object to directly append to

Args:
file_name (str): the name of the json file to create

Spiders¶

4 spiders are included in the project, located in cherry.Spiders

cherry.Spiders.SeekSpider¶

Scrapy spider object for crawling websites to extract dois

class cherry.Spiders.SeekSpider.SeekSpider(*args, **kwargs)¶

Spider for crawling webistes to extract dois

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create a SeekSpider

Kwargs:

start_urls (list): list of urls to start scraping with.

allowed_domains (list):list of domain names to limit scraping to

parse_obj(response)¶

parse a webpage and collect any dois on the page

Args:
response (Scrapy Response object): the response object for the current webpage
Yields:
item (Cherry.Items.SeekItem): scrapy item object for storage if dois found on the page

cherry.Spiders.PickSpider¶

Scrapy spider object for crawling websites to extract dois and collect metadata

class cherry.Spiders.PickSpider.PickSpider(*args, **kwargs)¶

Spider for visiting webpages and extracting dois and retrieving metadata

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

make a Pickspider

Kwargs:

start_urls (list): list of websites to visit

allowed_domains (list): list of domains to constrain the spider to

check_doi(response)¶

check for the existence of a doi

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for message received from crossref agency api
Yields:
item (CherryItems.CrossRefItem): uncompleted metadata for article for doi not indexed by crossref
errback1(response)¶

Error handling for failed url request

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for error message received from server
Yields:
item (CherryItems.BrokenItem): error reporting item
errback2(response)¶

Error handling for failed request to crossrefs

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for error message received from server
Yields:
request to crossref agency api
errback3(response)¶

Error handling for when a doi doesnt exist

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for error message received from server
Yields:
item (CherryItems.BrokenItem): error reporting item
parse(response)¶

parse a webpage, collect dois, send requests to crossref for metadata collection

Args:
response (scrapy response): Scrapy Response object for the webpage
Yields:
scrapy requests to Crossref for extracted dois
parse_crossref(response)¶

parse the message from crossref

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for message received from crossref
Yields:
item (CherryItems.CrossrefItem): partially complete article metadata to store
start_requests()¶

initialise and send requests for each url with relevant metadata

cherry.Spiders.ShakeSpider¶

Scrapy spider object for retrieving metadata for dois from list of dois

class cherry.Spiders.ShakeSpider.ShakeSpider(*args, **kwargs)¶

Spider for retrieving metadata for inputted dois

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

make a shakespider

Kwargs:

dois (list): list of dois to extract metadata from

doi_sources (list): list of source websites the dois have originated from

Yields:
scrapy Requests to Crossref to get doi metadata
check_doi(response)¶

check for the existence of a doi

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for message received from crossref agency api
Yields:
item (CherryItems.CrossRefItem): uncompleted metadata for article for doi not indexed by crossref
errback2(response)¶

Error handling for failed request to crossrefs

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for error message received from server
Yields:
request to crossref agency api
errback3(response)¶

Error handling for when a doi doesnt exist

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for error message received from server
Yields:
item (CherryItems.BrokenItem): error reporting item
parse(response)¶

parse the message from crossref

Args:
response (scrapy Response): scrapy response object for message received from crossref
Yields:
item (CherryItems.CrossrefItem): partially complete article metadata to store
start_requests()¶

initialise and send requests

cherry.Spiders.MunchSpider¶

Scrapy spider object for collecting metadata from publisher webpages

class cherry.Spiders.MunchSpider.MunchSpider(*args, **kwargs)¶

MunchSpider scrapy crawlspider parses a list of dx.doi.org/<doi> links to extract metadata from publishers

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Create a MunchSpider

Kwargs:

start_urls (list): list of dx.doi.org/<doi> links to visit

allowed_domains (list): list of allowed domains the spider may visit

publisher_database (object): either a mongodb client of Fake_mongo interface that when queried, gives xpaths to publisher webpage

crossref_items (dict) = partially resolved doi metadata items

choose_items(itemlist)¶

return most plausable item from a list of possible resolved items

Args:
itemlist (list): list of CherryItems.CompleteItem objects
Returns:
best_item (CherryItems.Complete_Item): item in itemlist with most completed fields
errback1(response)¶

Handle request error for redirection to publisher websites

Args:
response (Scrapy Response): failure message
Returns:
item (CherryItems.BrokenItem): failed collection item detailing failure
get_item(response, paths)¶

get complete metadata from publisher webpage

Args:

response (Scrapy Response): scrapy response object for current page

paths (list): Xpaths to extract meta data

Returns:
item (CherryItems.CompleteItem): complete metadata for associated article
get_pub_paths(publisher)¶

Get xpaths for a specified publisher website

Args:
publisher (str): website of publisher to query database on
Returns:
publishers_iterator (iterator): iterator that contains xpaths to try for current publisher
parse(response)¶

parse publisher webpage and extract article metadata

Args:
response(Scrapy Response): scrapy response object for recieved webpage
Yields:
item (CherryItems.CompleteItem or BrokenItem): succefully resolved record or error reporting item if error in collection unrecoverable
start_requests()¶

initialise and send requests for each url with relevant metadata

Items¶

Items are located in cherry.Items

cherry.Items¶

class cherry.Items.CherryItems.BrokenItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

scrapy item for encapsulating error messages in scraping

class cherry.Items.CherryItems.CompleteItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

Scrapy item for encapsulating complete metadata for an article

class cherry.Items.CherryItems.CrossRefItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

scrapy item for encapuslating partially complete metadata for an article

class cherry.Items.CherryItems.SeekItem(*args, **kwargs)¶

scraping item for encapsulating urls that may contain dois

Pipelines¶

Pipelines for processing scraped items are located in cherry.Pipelines

cherry.Pipelines¶

Data processing pipeline to record scrapy items correctly

class cherry.Pipelines.CherryPipelines.CherryPipeline(settings)¶

Pipeline for handing scrapy items generated in scraping

__init__(settings)¶

Make a cherryPipeline

Args:
settings (Scrapy Settings): Settings object in use for this scraping run
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

close_spider(spider)¶

perform actions on termination of spider scraping

Args:
spider (Scrapy Spider): spider that is closing
process_item(item, spider)¶

Process an item generated in scraping

Args:

item (CherryItem): item to process

spider (scrapy.Spider): Current spider performing scrape

Returns:
item (CherryItem): processed item
